paper_title: Enhanced CO2 photoreduction via tuning halides in perovskites

catalyst.source: Via regulating ratio of Br and Cl, the yield of CO and CH 4 changes obviously and the optimized catalyst is CsPb(Br 0.5 /Cl 0.5 ) 3 with a total yield of CO and CH 4 up to 875 lmol/g (selectivity of 99) which outperforms any other reported halide perovskites and is 4.5 and 9.1 folds higher than that of CsPbBr 3 and CsPbCl 3 under the same condition.
catalyst.context: Development of efficient, selective and low-cost photocatalysts, ideally constructed from Earth-abundant elements, is still a big challenge for CO 2 photoreduction.Herein, adopting mixed halides strategy, the activity of all-inorganic perovskites toward CO 2 reduction is enhanced sharply under simulated sunlight without photosensitizer, meanwhile maintaining high selectivity of CO and CH 4 production.Via regulating ratio of Br and Cl, the yield of CO and CH 4 changes obviously and the optimized catalyst is CsPb(Br 0.5 /Cl 0.5 ) 3 with a total yield of CO and CH 4 up to 875 lmol/g (selectivity of 99) which outperforms any other reported halide perovskites and is 4.5 and 9.1 folds higher than that of CsPbBr 3 and CsPbCl 3 under the same condition.The efficient charge separation and moderate stability in mixedhalide perovskites may account for the excellent performance in CO 2 reduction.This study may provide a new strategy in design of high performance and low-cost halide perovskite materials for photocatalysis.

0.5 /Cl 0.5 ) 3 as catalyst was observed, however, after third recycle (corresponding to 27 h reaction), the yield of both CO and CH 4 sharply reduced to 38 and 23.The decrease of catalytic activity may result from the moderate durability of perovskite materials under the long-time irradiation.For other CsPb (Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 (x 0, 0.3, 0.7, 1), with the Cl content enhanced, the reduced degree in reactivity decreased.According to these experiments, the ratio of Br and Cl at 0.5:0.5 should be the most active rather than the most stable.The advantage in band energy and the moderate stability of CsPb(Br 0.5 /Cl 0.5 ) 3 may make it be the most appropriate catalyst for CO 2 photoreduction.Fig. 6.The GC-MS result of an isotopic experiment with 13 CO 2 as carbon sources using CsPb(Br 0.5 /Cl 0.5 ) 3 as the catalyst.Given that charge separation plays a crucial role in the redox reaction, transient photocurrent responses were employed to reveal the rooted reason behind the predominant photocatalytic performance of CsPb(Br 0.5 /Cl 0.5 ) 3 materials in CO 2 reduction.First, the photoelectrodes were prepared and the thickness of the film cross-section was determined by SEM image of CsPb(Br 0.5 /Cl 0.5 ) 3 photoelectrode (Fig. S8y).The photocurrent responses were collected under Xe-300 lamp with AM 1.5 filter under dark and light conditions.In Fig. 7b, the photocurrent density of mixed-halide perovskites CsPb(Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 (x 0.7, 0.3) have similar phenomena during on-off irradiation but with low photocurrent density.These results illuminate the charge separation of CsPb(Br catalyst for CO 2 photoreduction.

Preparation of Cs-oleate.Firstly, Cs 2 CO 3 (0.8140 g), OA (2.5 mL) and ODE (10 mL) were added into a 50-mL 2-neck round bottomed flask, and then the flask was evacuated for about 5 min at room temperature.Then the flask was refilled with nitrogen and evacuated at 120 C for 30 min, then maintaining 120 C until obtaining the transparent solution.Before using, the Cs-oleate solution was heated until totally dissolved. Synthesis of colloidal CsPb(Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 (x 1, 0.7, 0.5, 0.3, 0) nanocrystals.The halide perovskite CsPb(Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 (x 1, 0.7, 0.5, 0.3, 0) nanocrystals were prepared according to the reported literature 47.Take CsPbBr 3 nanocrystals as an example.PbBr 2 (0.0661 g), OAm (0.8 mL), OA (0.8 mL), and ODE (5 mL) were added to a 50-mL 2-neck round bottomed flask.The flask was evacuated and refilled with N 2 when the solution was heated to 120 C for 30 min.After that, the solution was increased to 185 C.At 185 C, dried OAm (0.8 mL) and dried OA (0.8 mL) was injected to solubilize the solution.Then the Cs-oleate (0.064 mL) was swiftly injected into the reaction system and after 5 s the solution was cooled with an ice bath.The nanocrystals were collected by centrifugation at 8000 rpm for 5 min, and then washed with hexane and ethyl acetate for five times.For CsPbCl 3 nanocrystals, 1 mL of TOP was required to solubilize PbCl 2 . Synthesis of CsPbBr 3 quantum dots with the orthorhombic phase 42.Firstly, PbBr 2 (367.01 mg) was fully dissolved in the mixture of DMF (20 mL), hexanoic acid (232.32 mg) and octylamine (258.48 mg).Subsequently, 1 mL of Cs-oleate solution was added to this solution.Finally, 0.5 mL of the mixed solution was added into a flask with 20 mL of toluene, followed centrifuging and washing process (by ethyl acetate) twice. The powder X-ray diffraction patterns (PXRD) were recorded on a SmartLab X-ray diffractometer.The morphology and nanostructure were investigated on transmission electron microscope (TEM) and high-resolution TEM (HRTEM) (JEM-2100Plus).X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) characterizations were performed on an Escalab 250 instrument with a monochromatized Al Ka X-ray sources.The absorption behavior of the samples was studied by the UV-vis spectrometer (Shimadzu UV-2600).UV-vis diffuse reflection spectroscopy (DRS) was obtained on a U-3010 spectrophotometer (Hitachi, Japan).Photoluminescence (PL) spectra were scanned on a photoluminescence spectrometer (Hitachi F-4600), under an excitation wavelength of 362 nm except for CsPbCl 3 nanocrystals (excited by 320 nm).The elemental analysis is carried out by inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS).The film thickness of photoelectrode was determined by Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM).The product of the photocatalytic reaction was tested by the GC-9800 spectrometer.The HP 6890GC-5973MSD gas chromatography-mass spectrometer (GC-MS) was employed to analyze the CO product generated from the 13 CO 2 (98 enriched) isotope experiments. Fabrication of the CsPb(Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 (x 0.7, 0.5, 0.3) photoelectrodes.The ITO substrate was cleaned by sonicating sequentially in deionized water, alcohol and acetone, each for 10 min.The ITO substrate was divided into the size of approximately 1 cm A 1 cm.A fixed amount of CsPb(Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 (x 1, 0.7, 0.5, 0.3, 0) toluene suspension was subsequently dropped onto the ITO substrate.The as-prepared photoelectrodes were subsequently dried at room temperature overnight. All the photoelectrochemical characterizations were performed on the electrochemical workstation (CHI660e, CH Instruments, Inc., USA) with a three-electrode configuration with the assembled photoelectrodes as the working electrode, the Pt mesh as the counter electrode and the Ag/AgCl (in 3 M KCl) as the reference electrode.The ethyl acetate with 0.1 M tetrabutylammonium hexafluorophosphate (TBAPF 6 ) was filled in the cell as electrolyte.The light source and the light density were identical with that in the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction test. Photocatalytic performance tests.The photocatalytic CO 2 reduction was conducted in a homemade 75 mL sealed cell with 0.5 mg CsPb(Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 (x 1, 0.7, 0.5, 0.3, 0) nanocrystals as the catalysts and 6 mL ethyl acetate as the solvent.Before the reduction, high purity CO 2 (99.99) gas was bubbled in the ethyl acetate solvent for around 20 min until the CO 2 concentration reached saturation and dissolved oxygen was removed completely.A 300 W Xenon lamp with AM 1.5 filter was used as the light source.The distance between the homemade sealed cell and the 300 W xenon lamp is about 8 cm and the sample geometry of irradiation was about 2 cm A 3 cm.The light intensity was around 200 mW/cm 2 .All of the experiments were carried out under ambient pressure and the reaction system was kept at 20 C under a cooling water system.The gaseous products generated during CO 2 photocatalytic reduction were collected by a 1 mL syringe and then immediately analyzed by GC-9800 equipped with a flame ionization detector (FID), and a thermal conductivity detector (TCD) after 9 h. Control experiments.The control experiment was conducted in a homemade 75 mL sealed cell with 0.5 mg CsPb(Br 0.5 /Cl 0.5 ) 3 nanocrystals as the catalysts and 6 mL ethyl acetate as the solvent.Before the reduction, high purity Ar (99.99) gas was bubbled in the ethyl acetate solvent for around 20 min until the dissolved oxygen was removed completely.A 300 W xenon lamp with AM 1.5 filter was used as the light source.After 9 h, the gaseous products were collected by a 1 mL syringe and then immediately analyzed by GC-9800 equipped with a flame ionization detector (FID), and a thermal conductivity detector (TCD). lamp.context: In summary, we provide a strategy to enhance the CO 2 photoreduction efficiency, exploring low-cost and selective mixed-halide perovskite CsPb(Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 (x 0.7, 0.5, 0.3) materials as catalysts.Via hot-injection method, these mixed-halide perovskites with cubic phase and a size of 10.5 nm are prepared, which exhibit excellent visible-light absorption property.The E g of these mixed-halide perovskite ranges from 2.51 to 2.83 eV which is smaller than classical semiconductors, such as TiO 2 and ZnO.The E CB of them is all around A1.70 eV, higher than the reductive potential of CO 2 to CO (A0.5 eV) which provides the guarantee for CO 2 photoreduction.Under simulated sunlight and absence of additive of the photosensitizer, mixed-halide perovskites exhibit excellent photocatalytic efficiency and selectivity in converting CO 2 to CO and CH 4 .The ratio of Br and Cl in perovskite materials has a significant effect on the photocatalytic performance.The optimized catalyst is CsPb(Br 0.5 /Cl 0.5 ) 3 with a total amount of 875 lmol/g of CO and CH 4 (selectivity of 99) which is 4.5, 9.1 and 6 folds higher than the yield of CsPbBr 3 , CsPbCl 3 and CsPbBr 3 with orthorhombic phase under the same condition.The moderate stability and appropriate band energy of mixed-halide perovskite may account for the high yield of CsPb(Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 .The more efficient charge separation of CsPb(Br 0.5 /Cl 0.5 ) 3 than that of CsPb (Br 0.7 /Cl 0.3 ) 3 and CsPb(Br 0.3 /Cl 0.7 ) 3 may lead to the higher activity of CsPb(Br 0.5 /Cl 0.5 ) 3 .What's more, this activity and selectivity of CsPb(Br 0.5 /Cl 0.5 ) 3 outperform popular semiconductor catalysts, such as TiO 2 , CdS and g-C 3 N 4 .We believe that these findings pave new routes in designing efficient, selective and low-cost perovskite for CO 2 photoreduction. We examined the surface chemical binding of CsPb(Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 (x 1, 0.7, 0.5, 0.3, 0) materials with X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) (Fig. S2y).The peaks of Cs 3d of CsPbBr 3 (x 1) at 724.0 and 738.1 eV are gradually red-shift to 723.8 and 737.8 eV (CsPbCl 3 , x 0), respectively (Fig. 3a).For the peaks of Pb 4f, they individually exhibit blue-shift from 137.8 and 142.7 eV of CsPbBr 3 to 138.0 and 142.9 eV of CsPbCl 3 (Fig. 3b).These indicate that bonding environment of Cs and Pb atoms is changed via tuning the ratios of Br/Cl.The peaks of Br 3d and/or Cl 2p in CsPb(Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 (x 1, 0.7, 0.5, 0.3, 0) are almost unchanged (Fig. 3c,d).To better understand the actual ratio of Br/Cl in the synthesized perovskites, the elemental analysis is carried out by ICP-MS (Table S1y), which indicates that the actual ratio is generally consistent with the molar feed ratio. operation mode.source: The gaseous products generated during CO 2 photocatalytic reduction were collected by a 1 mL syringe and then immediately analyzed by GC-9800 equipped with a flame ionization detector (FID), and a thermal conductivity detector (TCD) after 9 h.
operation mode.context: All chemicals were directly used without further purification.Cesium carbonate (Cs 2 CO 3 , 99, Aladdin), lead (II) bromide (PbBr 2 , 99.5, Aladdin), lead (II) chloride (PbCl 2 , 99.5, Aladdin), oleylamine (OAm, technical grade 90, Aladdin), oleic acid (OA, technical grade 90, Alfa Aesar), 1-octadecene (ODE, technical grade 90, Aladdin), trioctylphosphine (TOP, Strem, 97), ethyl acetate (AR, Aladdin), hexanes (AR, Aladdin), dimethyl formamide (DMF, AR), toluene (AR, Aladdin), hexanoic acid (AR, Aladdin), octylamine (AR, Aladdin). Preparation of Cs-oleate.Firstly, Cs 2 CO 3 (0.8140 g), OA (2.5 mL) and ODE (10 mL) were added into a 50-mL 2-neck round bottomed flask, and then the flask was evacuated for about 5 min at room temperature.Then the flask was refilled with nitrogen and evacuated at 120 C for 30 min, then maintaining 120 C until obtaining the transparent solution.Before using, the Cs-oleate solution was heated until totally dissolved. Synthesis of colloidal CsPb(Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 (x 1, 0.7, 0.5, 0.3, 0) nanocrystals.The halide perovskite CsPb(Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 (x 1, 0.7, 0.5, 0.3, 0) nanocrystals were prepared according to the reported literature 47.Take CsPbBr 3 nanocrystals as an example.PbBr 2 (0.0661 g), OAm (0.8 mL), OA (0.8 mL), and ODE (5 mL) were added to a 50-mL 2-neck round bottomed flask.The flask was evacuated and refilled with N 2 when the solution was heated to 120 C for 30 min.After that, the solution was increased to 185 C.At 185 C, dried OAm (0.8 mL) and dried OA (0.8 mL) was injected to solubilize the solution.Then the Cs-oleate (0.064 mL) was swiftly injected into the reaction system and after 5 s the solution was cooled with an ice bath.The nanocrystals were collected by centrifugation at 8000 rpm for 5 min, and then washed with hexane and ethyl acetate for five times.For CsPbCl 3 nanocrystals, 1 mL of TOP was required to solubilize PbCl 2 . Synthesis of CsPbBr 3 quantum dots with the orthorhombic phase 42.Firstly, PbBr 2 (367.01 mg) was fully dissolved in the mixture of DMF (20 mL), hexanoic acid (232.32 mg) and octylamine (258.48 mg).Subsequently, 1 mL of Cs-oleate solution was added to this solution.Finally, 0.5 mL of the mixed solution was added into a flask with 20 mL of toluene, followed centrifuging and washing process (by ethyl acetate) twice. The powder X-ray diffraction patterns (PXRD) were recorded on a SmartLab X-ray diffractometer.The morphology and nanostructure were investigated on transmission electron microscope (TEM) and high-resolution TEM (HRTEM) (JEM-2100Plus).X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) characterizations were performed on an Escalab 250 instrument with a monochromatized Al Ka X-ray sources.The absorption behavior of the samples was studied by the UV-vis spectrometer (Shimadzu UV-2600).UV-vis diffuse reflection spectroscopy (DRS) was obtained on a U-3010 spectrophotometer (Hitachi, Japan).Photoluminescence (PL) spectra were scanned on a photoluminescence spectrometer (Hitachi F-4600), under an excitation wavelength of 362 nm except for CsPbCl 3 nanocrystals (excited by 320 nm).The elemental analysis is carried out by inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS).The film thickness of photoelectrode was determined by Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM).The product of the photocatalytic reaction was tested by the GC-9800 spectrometer.The HP 6890GC-5973MSD gas chromatography-mass spectrometer (GC-MS) was employed to analyze the CO product generated from the 13 CO 2 (98 enriched) isotope experiments. Fabrication of the CsPb(Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 (x 0.7, 0.5, 0.3) photoelectrodes.The ITO substrate was cleaned by sonicating sequentially in deionized water, alcohol and acetone, each for 10 min.The ITO substrate was divided into the size of approximately 1 cm A 1 cm.A fixed amount of CsPb(Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 (x 1, 0.7, 0.5, 0.3, 0) toluene suspension was subsequently dropped onto the ITO substrate.The as-prepared photoelectrodes were subsequently dried at room temperature overnight. All the photoelectrochemical characterizations were performed on the electrochemical workstation (CHI660e, CH Instruments, Inc., USA) with a three-electrode configuration with the assembled photoelectrodes as the working electrode, the Pt mesh as the counter electrode and the Ag/AgCl (in 3 M KCl) as the reference electrode.The ethyl acetate with 0.1 M tetrabutylammonium hexafluorophosphate (TBAPF 6 ) was filled in the cell as electrolyte.The light source and the light density were identical with that in the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction test. Photocatalytic performance tests.The photocatalytic CO 2 reduction was conducted in a homemade 75 mL sealed cell with 0.5 mg CsPb(Br x /Cl 1Ax ) 3 (x 1, 0.7, 0.5, 0.3, 0) nanocrystals as the catalysts and 6 mL ethyl acetate as the solvent.Before the reduction, high purity CO 2 (99.99) gas was bubbled in the ethyl acetate solvent for around 20 min until the CO 2 concentration reached saturation and dissolved oxygen was removed completely.A 300 W Xenon lamp with AM 1.5 filter was used as the light source.The distance between the homemade sealed cell and the 300 W xenon lamp is about 8 cm and the sample geometry of irradiation was about 2 cm A 3 cm.The light intensity was around 200 mW/cm 2 .All of the experiments were carried out under ambient pressure and the reaction system was kept at 20 C under a cooling water system.The gaseous products generated during CO 2 photocatalytic reduction were collected by a 1 mL syringe and then immediately analyzed by GC-9800 equipped with a flame ionization detector (FID), and a thermal conductivity detector (TCD) after 9 h. Control experiments.The control experiment was conducted in a homemade 75 mL sealed cell with 0.5 mg CsPb(Br 0.5 /Cl 0.5 ) 3 nanocrystals as the catalysts and 6 mL ethyl acetate as the solvent.Before the reduction, high purity Ar (99.99) gas was bubbled in the ethyl acetate solvent for around 20 min until the dissolved oxygen was removed completely.A 300 W xenon lamp with AM 1.5 filter was used as the light source.After 9 h, the gaseous products were collected by a 1 mL syringe and then immediately analyzed by GC-9800 equipped with a flame ionization detector (FID), and a thermal conductivity detector (TCD). Isotopic experiment.The isotopic experiment was conducted in a homemade 75 mL sealed cell with 0.5 mg CsPb(Br 0.5 /Cl 0.5 ) 3 nanocrystals as the catalysts and 6 mL ethyl acetate as the solvent.Before the reduction, 13 CO 2 (98) gas was bubbled in the ethyl acetate solvent for around 20 min until the dissolved oxygen was removed completely.A 300 W xenon lamp with AM 1.5 filter was used as the light source.After 9 h, the 13 C-labeled product was tested by GC-MS.
